featured.text: In the United States, parents and educators have come to regard the prom as an important lesson in social skills.
The moral lesson is that slow and steady wins the race.
From then on, the donkey learned the lesson, and ___(40)___ carried Amir’s salt to the market without ruining it.
But learning to budget your money is the first lesson you must learn to be independent.

other.text: Overall, many moral lessons from the last match are highlighted.
It is a lesson they must always 35 on the field.
The moral lesson is “First 35 your strengths, and then change the playing field to suit them.”
The moral lesson is that 33 and consistent will always beat slow and steady.
Wherever football is played, the players learn the rough-and-tumble lesson that only through the 34 of each member can the team win.

definition.zh_def: 課程或教學的內容，通常用於學校或教育機構中。
definition.en_def: A unit of instruction or a period of learning in a school or educational setting.
definition.example: She learned a lot from her history lesson today.
